snippet: Ending four decades of debate over how to curb corruption, India’s upper house of Parliament approved the creation of an independent agency to fight bribery and other illegal acts.
abstract: India's upper house of Parliament passes measure to create independent anticorruption agency, after more than four decades of debate over how to curb corruption.

byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and HARI KUMAR

lead_paragraph: Ending four decades of debate over how to curb corruption, India’s upper house of Parliament approved the creation of an independent agency to fight bribery and other illegal acts.

headline.main: India’s Upper House Approves Anticorruption Agency
headline.print_headline: India: Anticorruption Agency Wins Vote in Upper House
